replyContent: Hi, The app uses Bluetooth to assess whether the users are in close proximity (2m or closer), for 15mins or more. When an App user tests positive, they upload their temporary identifiers for the period that they were considered infectious with COVID-19. This information is then used by your device to identify whether you have been in contact.

content: The premise of the app is good. However, the key fundamentals are lacking. I have just received an alert to say I was possibly near someone who now has Covid. I clicked on the alert notification and was sent to the app for more information, but there was no further information. I can see from a number of other uses that apparently, Google randomly sends alerts/messages to confirm the app is working. Also, if there was an issue, there would be information within the app. Surely an NHS app can't allow Google to send false positives as a "check it works" validation. Firstly that is very worrying for people. Secondly, it seems the app keeps crying wolf too many times which will surely take away the trust people have in it. And on to the app itself. I can't see where I have scanned in or visited (it is my data, I should have access to it). I also would expect that if I have a correct alert, it tells me where the incident was, at what time and when the other persons symptoms started to show. Reason, I mostly drive and don't have contact face to face. So there could be an incident alert come up and it is down to me sitting next to someone else in another car at the traffic lights and this has triggered me as being close to them. In reality, this situation poses low risks. But without that information, I am left to worry, have a test and spend up to two weeks worrying even more about possibly another cry wolf situation. I hope the app keeps getting developed as something like this is very important to a lot of people, and if the right people work on it, could prove invaluable.

replyContent: Hello, periodically, Google will send you notifications to ensure you are aware the app is still working, please be assured that if we send information you that need to act on, it will be in the app. More information: https://faq.covid19.nhs.uk/article/KA-01252/en-us
